meanings.sent1: The garbage in the bin ponged terribly.
meanings.sent2: After a few days, the old socks ponged in the laundry basket.
meanings.sent3: The ponged cheese made everyone in the room wrinkle their noses.
meanings.sent4: The alleyway ponged like a skunk had taken up residence.
meanings.sent5: The bathroom ponged so badly that even the cat avoided it.

meanings.definition: to have a strong, unpleasant smell
meanings.sent1: The fish market always ponged when you walked by.
meanings.sent2: His gym bag ponged of sweat and dirt after the workout.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten lunch in the fridge ponged worse than a dirty diaper.
meanings.sent4: The room ponged as if something had died in the corner.
meanings.sent5: The socks ponged so strongly that they needed to be washed twice.

meanings.sent1: The ponged from the sewer filled the street with an awful stench.
meanings.sent2: The room was filled with a ponged that made everyone gag.
meanings.sent3: The ponged of rotten eggs lingered in the kitchen for hours.
meanings.sent4: The ponged of the skunk spray was overpowering in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The ponged of the garbage truck was enough to make anyone hold their breath.
